conclusion: Determine the potential difference between points a and b when the magnetic field changes.
The loop is a square with a side length of 0.2 m. Half of the square is in the magnetic field.
The area exposed to the magnetic field is half the area of the square.
The area of the square is 0.04 m^2.
The area exposed to the magnetic field is 0.02 m^2.
The magnetic field B changes at a rate of 10 T/s.
The rate of change of magnetic flux through the exposed area is 0.2 Wb/s.
Faraday's Law states that the induced EMF is equal to the negative rate of change of magnetic flux.
The magnitude of the induced EMF is 0.2 V.
The induced EMF causes a current to flow around the loop to oppose the change in magnetic flux.
Using Lenz's Law, the current will flow clockwise, making point a at a higher potential than point b.
The potential difference V_ab between points a and b is equal to the induced EMF.
The potential difference V_ab is 0.2 V.
